byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: American and Iraqi officials say Iraqi security forces are preparing to take back strategic city of Ramadi from Islamic State; Pres Obama says fall of city to ISIS has invigorated Iraqi government and accelerated American plans to provide training and equipment to Iraqi forces, including Sunni fighters.
lead_paragraph: President Obama said the fall of the key western city had galvanized the Iraqi government and accelerated an American effort to train forces there.

headline.main: Iraqi Forces Plan Offensive to Retake Ramadi From ISIS
headline.print_headline: Iraq Prepares to Take Back City From ISIS

snippet: President Obama said the fall of the key western city had galvanized the Iraqi government and accelerated an American effort to train forces there.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
